meanings.definition: To be the male parent of
meanings.sent1: The lion sired many cubs in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The dog sired a litter of puppies last spring.
meanings.sent3: The king cubs sired by the lion were known for their bravery.
meanings.sent4: The champion horse sired a new generation of racers.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl sired offspring that inherited its keen eyesight.

meanings.sent1: He sired a son who grew up to be a great leader.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sired many children who helped on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The comedian sired jokes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist sired creativity in all who visited the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher sired knowledge in the minds of young students.

meanings.definition: To give birth to; bring into being
meanings.sent1: The volcano sired a new island in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The writer sired a best-selling novel that captivated readers.
meanings.sent3: The chef sired a delicious recipe that became famous.
meanings.sent4: The inventor sired a groundbreaking invention that changed the world.
meanings.sent5: The musician sired a beautiful melody that touched hearts.
